ScopeNote.notesText: Prenten die alleen met behulp van het zeefdrukprocedé zijn gemaakt, handmatig of fotografisch. Het drukken vindt plaats door inkt of verf door een zeef te duwen waarin een ontwerp is aangebracht door bepaalde gedeelten af te sluiten.

aat:AAT.englishScopeNote: Refers to the activity of producing prints as works of art; for the specific processes employed, use such terms as "intaglio printing" or "mezzotint." For the production of other types of printed material, use "printing."

ScopeNote.notesText: Wordt gebruikt voor de handeling van het maken van afdrukken als kunst; gebruik termen als 'diepdruk' of 'mezzotint' voor de specifieke procédés die hiermee te maken hebben . Gebruik 'drukken' voor het produceren van andere soorten gedrukt materiaal.

Contributor.fullName: Bureau AAT, RKD (Netherlands Institute for Art History; The Hague, The Netherlands)

ScopeNote.notesText: Úsese para la actividad de realizar impresiones como obras de arte. Para los procesos específicos empleados, utilizar términos como "impresión al intaglio” o "medio tono”. Para la producción de otros tipos de material impreso, usar "impresión”.

tgn:Place.name: nation
tgn:Place.description: Swiss Confederation of area smaller than modern nation was created in 1291; 22 cantons in confederation since 1815, adopted federal constitution 1848

tgn:TGN.tgn:Note: Area settled in pre-Christian period; had Roman encampments 1st cen.; Germanic tribes invaded 3rd-6th cen.; ruled by Franks 9th cen., Holy Roman Empire from 11th cen.; first confederation of cantons was established 13th cen., others joined 14th-19th cen.; official languages are German, French and Italian, though Romansch (Rhaeto-Roman) is also a national language.

field_string.description: Titles, identifying phrases, or names given to a work of art, architecture, or material culture.
field_string.label: Title

field_string.description: Concise description of the date or range of dates associated with the creation, design, production, presentation, performance, construction, or alteration of the work or its components, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance.
field_string.label: Date

field_string.description: Information about the dimensions, size, or scale of the work, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance.
field_string.label: Measurements

field_string.description: Text that describes the content and context of the work, including comments and an interpretation that may supplement, qualify, or explain the physical characteristics, subject, circumstances of creation or discovery, or other information about the work.
field_string.label: Description

field_string.description: Seal or inscription located on object.
field_string.label: Seals & Inscriptions

field_string.description: Publications that this artwork or object have appeared in.
field_string.label: Publications

field_string.description: Exhibitions that this artwork or object have appeared in.
field_string.label: Exhibitions
field_string.value: Hans Hinterreiter: A Theory of Form and Color," July 9 - September 12, 2013.

field_string.description: Date acquired by the Fine Arts Gallery.
field_string.label: Date Acquired

field_string.description: Describes who gifted the object to the Fine Arts Gallery.
field_string.label: Gift of

field_string.description: Information that describes whether this object is a gift, bequest, or purchase.
field_string.label: Credit Line
field_string.value: Collection of Vanderbilt University Fine Arts Gallery

field_string.description: Denotes a specific collection within the general permanent collection of the Fine Arts Gallery.
field_string.label: Collection

field_string.description: Last change made to the record.
field_string.label: Last Change

field_string.description: Any important notes regarding this artwork or object.
field_string.label: Notes
field_string.value: #127 Received from Carl van der Voort, April, 1995, (New Haven, CT shipment) Died September 15, 1989 ed 50/50 Published by Taller Ibograf, Ibiza, Spain (CVDV's graphic workshop)

field_string.description: Any unique identifiers assigned to a work by the current or last known repository.
field_string.label: Accession Number

field_lookup.description: Name, brief biographical information, and roles (if necessary) of the named creator or creators in the design and production of the work, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance.
field_lookup.label: Creator

field_lookup.description: Name of the culture, people, or nationality from which the work originated.
field_lookup.label: Country/Culture

linkedField.allTerms: Confédération Suisse|Confédération Helvétique|Confederazione Svizzera|Swiss Confederation|Helvetic Confederation|Helvetic Republic|Rhaetia|Confédération suisse|CHE|Confederazione Elvetica|Svizzra|Confederaziun Helvetica|Suíça|La Suisse|CH|ISO756|SZ00|Switzerland|Schweiz (nation)|Schweiz|Suisse|Svizzera|Suiza|Zwitserland|Helvetia|Schweizerishe Eidgenossenschaft|Swiss|Svizra|Confederaziun Svizra

field_lookup.description: Term that identifies the named, defined style, historical or artistic period, movement, group, or school whose characteristics are represented in the work being catalogued.
field_lookup.label: Style/Period

field_lookup.description: Indication of the substances or materials used in the creation of a work, as well as any implements, production or manufacturing techniques, processes, or methods incorporated in its fabrication, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance.
field_lookup.label: Medium

linkedField.allTerms: screen prints|silkscreen prints|silkscreens|serigraphs|zeefdruk|screen print|silk screen prints|silk-screen prints|serigraphie|prints, screen|zeefdrukken|serigrafia|silk screens|screenprints|serigraphies|serigrafias

field_lookup.description: Term used to categorize a work by grouping it together with other works on the basis of similar characteristics, including materials, form, shape, function, etc. A list of the 16 terms accepted by Artstor may be provided.
field_lookup.label: Artstor Classification

field_lookup.description: A type of “nationality” field, though not in adjectival form; country refers to the modern name of the country from which the artist came. A list of those currently in use by Artstor may be provided.
field_lookup.label: Artstor Country

field_lookup.description: The copyright status of the digital object. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled statement from RightsStatements.org. For local or unique rights, catalogers may add new terms to the list. For information on how to use the provided rights statements, go to https://rightsstatements.org/page/1.0/?language=en.
field_lookup.label: Rights

field_lookup.description: The terms under which the digital object may be used by others. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled statement from CreativeCommons.org. For local or unique licenses, catalogers may add new terms to the list. For information on how to use the provided licenses, go to https://creativecommons.org/licenses/.
field_lookup.label: License
